Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.(a) In 2015, the United States generated 263 million metric tons of municipal solid waste <math alttext="M S W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(MSW)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, with more than half of the waste ending up in sanitary landfills.(i) Describe a potential environmental problem that could result from rain falling on a sanitary landfill.

(ii) Describe one potential solution to the problem from part (<math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>)(<math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>i</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>).

(iii) Some cities use recycling programs to reduce the amount of <math alttext="M S W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> being disposed of in sanitary landfills. Propose a solution, other than municipal recycling programs, to reduce the amount of <math alttext="M S W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> needing to be disposed of in landfills.

(iv) Justify the solution proposed in (<math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>)(<math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>iii</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) with a benefit, other than reducing the amount of <math alttext="M S W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> needing to be disposed of in landfills.

(b) The table below shows the total <math alttext="M S W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (in metric tons) and percent <math alttext="M S W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> recycled over time in the United States.YearTotal <math alttext="M S W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> recycled (millions of metric tons)Percent of <math alttext="M S W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> recycled19605819707819801210199023132000572720107633(i) Calculate the percent change in the annual total <math alttext="M S W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> recycled from 1960 to 2000 in the United States. Show your work.
(ii) Calculate the total <math alttext="M S W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> generated in 2000 in the United States. Show your work.

(iii) If paper products accounted for 33% of the total <math alttext="M S W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MSW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> recycled in 2010 and about <math alttext="7 cubic meters"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> of landfill space is saved for each metric ton of paper products recycled, calculate how much landfill space was saved by recycling paper products in 2010 in the United States.
